Sure, here's a sample script for appointment setting for a real estate business, which incorporates strategies used by Jordan Belfort:

Opening:
"Hello, my name is [Your Name] and I'm calling on behalf of [Company Name]. We are a real estate company that specializes in helping property owners and investors with their real estate needs. May I speak with the person in charge of your property or real estate investments?"

Building Rapport:
"I understand that you're busy and I'll be quick. I've been in the industry for a while and I've noticed that many property owners and investors like yourself are not getting the level of service they deserve. I just wanted to know if you're happy with your current real estate services."

Pain Point:
"I'm sure you're aware of the challenges of managing and maintaining a property or navigating the real estate market. But did you know that a poorly managed property can lead to financial losses and wasted time? And that's not even considering the potential legal issues that come with owning a property."

Benefit:
"We understand the importance of managing and maintaining your property or navigating the real estate market effectively, and we're here to help. Our team of experts can help you with everything from property management, real estate investments and sales, property development, and legal issues. Our services are tailored to your specific needs and budget."

Call to Action:
"I'd like to schedule a free consultation with you at your earliest convenience. Would you be available for a call next [day and time]? If not, I can also schedule an appointment for a different day and time that works for you."

Closing:
"Great, I'll make sure to schedule that for you. Thank you for your time, and I look forward to speaking with you soon. Have a good day."

This script incorporates several key strategies used by Jordan Belfort, such as building rapport, identifying pain points, and highlighting the benefits of your service. It also includes a clear call to action, which encourages the prospect to schedule an appointment with you.
